title: Gizmo
description: An object, either virtual or real-world, on the scene. Only stationery (non-movable and always present) objects will be specified in mission description files

slug.description: User-friendly and URL-valid name of the object. [Learn more about the slug concept](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clean_URL#Slug).

spatial.description: Object's position and orientation in space

position.description: Object's position (latitude, longitude, elevation). Positive latitude corresponds to Northern Hemisphere, positive longitude corresponds to Eastern Hemisphere, elevation is measured in meters above sea level

orientation.description: Object's orientation (Taitâ€“Bryan angles in North-East-Down coordinate system)

yaw.description: Yaw angle in degrees, relative to the north. Positive direction is clockwise looking top down

pitch.description: Pitch angle in degrees, relative to the horizontal position. Positive direction is 'nose up'

roll.description: Roll angle in degrees, relative to the horizontal position. Positive direction is counter-clockwise looking at the 'nose' of the object
